channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Martin Dugard, Taking Midway
channel.desc: Historian Martin Dugard discusses the Battle of Midway in June 1942, highlighting U.S. and Japanese intelligence operations before the engagement and how the battle changed naval warfare.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Isabel Allende, My Name Is Emilia del Valle - A Novel
channel.desc: Isabel Allende discusses identity & resilience in her historical novel set in the 19th century against a backdrop of civil war in Chile.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Agust?n Fuentes, Sex is a Spectrum - The Biological Limits of the Binary
channel.desc: Anthropologist Agustin Fuentes argues that the male-female binary is a flawed understanding of biology; harvard Book Store hosted this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: FreedomFest 2025 - Helen Raleigh, Not Outsiders
channel.desc: Book TV interviews authors at FreedomFest, an annual libertarian conference held in 2025 in Palm Springs, California.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: FreedomFest 2025 - John Tamny, The Deficit Delusion
channel.desc: Book TV interviews authors at FreedomFest, an annual libertarian conference held in 2025 in Palm Springs, California.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: After Words
channel.desc: A guest host who shares an interest in the subject matter and a non-fiction author pair up to discuss the author's writings.

channel.title: After Words

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Paul Hawken, Carbon - The Book of Life
channel.desc: Environmentalist and entrepreneur Paul Hawken charts the role of carbon on Earth as both the building block of all life and its role in climate change. The Commonwealth Club of California in San Francisco hosted this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Quinn Slobodian, Hayek's Bastards - Race, Gold, IQ, and the Capitalism of the Far Right
channel.desc: History professor Quinn Slobodian suggests that Friedrich Hayek's philosophy is the basis of the modern far right; Harvard Book Store hosted this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Shirley Green, Revolutionary Blacks
channel.desc: The Fort Plain Museum in New York hosts authors and historians to discuss the Revolutionary War.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Sen. Lisa Murkowski, Far From Home
channel.desc: Senator Lisa Murkowski (R-AK) tells her own political story in Far From Home. She was first elected in 2001 and has served in the Senate since 2002.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Richard Brookhiser, Glorious Lessons - John Trumbull, Painter of the American Revolution
channel.desc: Author Richard Brookhiser talks about Revolutionary War era painter John Trumbull's time as an aid to Generals George Washington and Horatio Gates and his work documenting the conflict in visual form.
